meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Strong Job Growth Eases Concerns on the Economy Job growth was brisk in December as businesses added 167,000 jobs, further evidence that the economy is not likely to slip into a recession.
First-Baby Contest Draws Ire After disqualifying a baby born to Chinese immigrants from a contest, Toys ''R'' Us finds itself in the glare of the immigration debate.
Rethinking Thin Models Trying to ease concerns about dangerously thin models, fashion designers have offered guidelines for promoting healthier behavior.
For Fat Dogs, a Diet Pill The Food and Drug Administration announces its approval of the first prescription drug to treat obesity in dogs.
The Postseason Is Now The N.F.L. playoffs begin this afternoon when Kansas City takes on Indianapolis. Dallas plays Seattle tonight.

Asian Admissions Debate The percentage of Asian undergraduates at elite colleges -- 41 percent at the University of California, Berkeley -- is the new talking point in the affirmative action debate. Some say too many are admitted; others, not enough. Also: When high school is harder than college, what happens in college?
